snippet: The timing of a halt in peace talks between the government and the country’s main rebel group could not have been worse.
abstract: Editorial criticizes Colombian Pres Juan Manuel Santos for halting peace talks between government and the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia due to abduction of Gen Ruben Dario Alzate Mora; contends while kidnapping has potential to doom the talks, it could also serve to jump-start them if leaders on both sides manage to put peace process back on track.
lead_paragraph: The timing of a halt in peace talks between the government and the country’s main rebel group could not have been worse.

headline.main: Colombian Peace Process at an Impasse
headline.print_headline: Colombian Peace Process at an Impasse
